p: The study of Estaji et al. [ 18] regarding the influence of salinity on several parameters of S. hortensis plants revealed that the phenolic compounds increased upon salinity stress, a non-enzymatic defense mechanisms against salinity-induced oxidative stress; a similar increase being observed for the essential oil quantity and quality (revealed by the increase in the content of main components: carvacrol, γ-terpinene, p-cymene, myrcene and β-pinene.
